runs.comm: fullish outside off, a bit of swing away. Ahmadi pokes at it hesitantly, and chops it down into the pitch, bounces behind him towards the keeper
full, angling down leg, and Ahmadi looks for a flick, gets a tickle off his back leg down to the fine leg boundary
very full on middle and leg, punched towards mid-off
full outside off, sliced drive to third man
length ball, fourth stump line, defended towards short extra cover
overpitched on middle stump, no swing, whipped past a diving short midwicket but mid-on easily covers up behind him, moving to his right to field it
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
back of a length, angled across, looks to chop at it with no footwork, beats his outside edge

given! Was that pitching in line? It swung in and smacked him on the front pad, which was thrust halfway forward and across to play through the on side. They've reviewed it. Hits on the knee-roll, or just above. Nowhere near the inside edge. It's pitching in line, and it's clipping the top of leg stump, so Ahmadi has to go
back of a length, swinging down the leg side. Mangal can't get his bat around his body in time to connect with the glance
aims for the swinging yorker, ends up as a low full-toss that almost jams his toes. Brings his bat down in time to squeeze it into the leg side
full, wide outside off, left alone
length ball, straightening towards off stump, defended towards short extra cover

bowled him! That's a beauty, full, and it drifts in the air, into the batsman, continues along that angle after pitching, and sneaks into the gap that's opened up between the bat and pad of Ghani, who was playing for the turn
slow, flighted ball drifting in towards off stump, gets forward to smother it
a bit straighter in line, defended into the on side
length ball, going with the angle towards off stump, goes on the back foot and chops it to backward point
floated up towards leg stump, plays with a nice, straight bat to defend into the off side
length ball on off stump, going with the angle, presses forward to block
very full, a bit of swing from middle to off, and he pokes it away towards short cover, where McCullum - yes, really, him - misfields to allow a single
fullish, this one doesn't swing. Stanikzai looks to whip it into the leg side, it hits him on the pad, was angling down the leg side
back of a length, a bit of extra bounce, he's hit on the thigh pad while looking to work it through the leg side
full and wide, flat-batted to cover point

appeal for lbw, hits his pad on the full, it seemed to be angling down leg initially, did that swing and straighten enough? Stanikzai was looking to work it through the leg side, and I don't think that's hitting. You can see both middle and off stump on the front-on replay. It's actually hit him on the base of the front pad, outside leg stump.
full and wide, swinging away. Stanikzai goes for the big hit over mid-off, doesn't connect
fullish on off stump, jams his bat down, slightly away from his body, and hits the ball into his feet
full outside off, punched to mid-off
back of a length, angling across. Mangal leaves it alone
fullish outside off, presses forward to defend towards point
lovely. That's the perfect length to make the batsman think of coming forward without his feet responding to his mind. He plays for swing, the ball goes with the angle and beats his outside edge
length ball angled across, nice carry through to Ronchi after Mangal leaves it
looks to test him with a short ball, pretty well-directed, over the right shoulder. Through his hook a bit early and it's off the helmet over the slips. Umpire thought he edged that
full, angling into middle stump, clipped away to long leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man
length ball, angling in towards off stump, no swing, defended towards mid-on
short ball, sits up at a nice height outside off, pulls it away confidently in front of square. Short midwicket chases back all the way, but can't quite pull it back with the slide
fullish, angling in towards off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length outside off, pushes at it away from his body and gets it into the gap between gully and backward point, who were both diving towards each other

pokes another back of a length ball into the off side, runs out of his crease before his partner sends him back. Guptill moves quickly from backward point, fires in a throw at the stumps, misses. Would have been out had he hit
full outside off, punched to cover
full outside off, driven to short extra cover
full, angling into the pads, clipped away through square leg
back of a length, angling in. Jumps across to work it through the leg side, can't connect, hits him on the thigh pad
full outside off, a bit of outswing. Looks to launch that over extra cover, ends up slicing it over cover point
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended into the on side
fullish outside off. Looks to launch it over mid-on, with the angle. Ends up hitting the inside half of his bat and bouncing down to the fielder
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended to mid-off
again looks for that full length, but no swing away. Gets a good stride out to defend into the covers
in the blockhole, swings down leg. Mangal gets his front leg out of the way and digs it out into the off side
he's out of his crease and outside off stump before the bowler delivers. Shortish outside off, chops it down to second slip

gone! Goes after another shortish ball outside off. The shot was on, he was looking for the uppercut, but didn't get the elevation and ended up hitting a comfortable catch to Guptill at the squarer of two gullies
full, angling across, it's a touch overpitched and Shenwari opens his bat face to drive it through backward point
back of a length, angling in, straightening away outside off. Shenwari pushes at it away from his body, his feet following after the ball has beaten his bat
and again, a bit fuller this time. Shenwari pushes at it and then walks into the shot after the ball has straightened past his outside edge
a touch shorter this time. Shenwari shuffles across and leaves
full, angling in towards middle stump. Stops on him a bit, checks his drive to mid-on
fullish on a sixth-stump line, left alone
length ball outside off, straightens away a touch to beat Mangal's poking bat. There seemed to be a sound, but the Snicko spike was just before it passed the edge. No one appealed.
fullish, angling into the pads, and that's nicely played by Mangal, let it come to him and closed his bat face at the last moment to find the vacant backward square leg boundary
full outside off, a bit of swing in, driven into the covers
length ball outside off, punched to mid-off
back of a length outside off, again gets it to straighten past Mangal's outside edge. No footwork again, just a firm-handed poke away from the body
fuller now, and Mangal punches it back to the bowler
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended into the on side
banged in halfway, Mangal ducks under it
back of a length outside off, poked away towards gully
back of a length angling in towards off stump, defended into the cover point region
full and wide, not quite up there for the drive. Shenwari flashes and misses
length ball, flat, angling into off and middle, punched back to the bowler
tossed up now, on off stump, clipped down to long-on
nice angle in towards middle stump, teasing flight, presses forward to block
some drift in towards middle stump, quite full, poked into the on side
beautiful flight there, dipped on Shenwari as he pressed forward to defend, went with the arm and off the inside edge, into the leg side
just a touch short, a bit of width too, chopped away to sweeper cover
fullish outside off, slices that drive through point
length ball, angling in towards off stump, looks to dab it into the off side for a single, hits it a touch too firmly and too close to Guptill at second gully
off-stump yorker, jams the bat down and inside-edges into his back pad

dropped, was it? Or did it not carry? Back of a length outside off, doesn't get behind the line and has a jab at it with an angled bat. The edge drops down low towards Taylor, falling to his right at first slip, and I think it bounced just short of him and rolled away behind him
down the track now, gets inside the line, and slaps this away through cover point
very full outside off, opens his bat face to stab it to the right of second gully
length ball, slides in towards off stump, defended towards short cover
tossed up outside off, presses forward to push it into the covers
length ball, going with the angle towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
looks to work it into the leg side and it goes with the angle again, hits him on the front pad. Was drifting down leg
length ball on off stump, defended down the ground with soft hands
a bit slower and fuller, driven firmly to mid-off
length ball on off stump, stays in the crease and blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, nicely steered away but Guptill dives to his left from point to stop it
full on middle and off, straightens away just a touch. Pushes at it without really moving his feet, thick outside edge to third man
fullish, angling in towards off stump, hangs back and defends into the on side
shot. That was a short ball, angling into the body, and he leaned back to play a controlled ramp to third man
length ball outside off, pushes at it with no footwork, and the ball straightens to beat his edge

bowled him, that's Vettori's 300th! You don't want to cut him unless he's really short and wide. He's neither here, and he made a bit of room, and the ball kept coming in with the angle and knocked back his off stump. 12th bowler in ODIs to reach the landmark, and the first New Zealander
length ball, angling into middle stump, stays inside the line to defend into the off side
floated up, a bit of turn away from off stump, presses forward to smother it
full outside off, driven past cover diving to his left
full, drifting down leg. Shenwari plonks his front pad in the way
shortish, a bit of width, chopped away to deep point
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the covers
full on off stump, pushes it to the left of short cover, opening his bat face slightly
short outside off, jumps to get on top of the bounce and cut it away to the right of third man
length ball outside off, defended to short cover
on the pads, tucked away towards mid-on
back of a length outside off, punched to point
fullish, angling away from off stumo, presses forward to push into the covers
back of a length, angling into off stump, tucked away through square leg

fullish outside off, pokes it to the right of Guptill at point, thinks of a single, sends his partner back, and realises too late that the fielder wasn't able to pick it up cleanly with his right hand
short ball, angling in. Shenwari jumps and sways away from it, managing to drop his hands below the ball just in time
fullish on leg stump, clipped away towards fine leg
another short ball angling into the body. Jumps, rides the bounce, and plays a controlled chop through backward point
fullish outside off, doesn't get that front foot out but throws his hands at the drive anyway, can't connect
length ball on off stump, pushed to the right of point and this time they pick up an easy single. That stopped on the batsman a bit but he played nice and close to his body
full, angling down leg. Can't connect with the flick, hits him on the left pad
back of a length on off and middle, defended towards mid-on
full outside off, driven to extra cover
short, angling into the body, manages to help it away towards fine leg even though he didn't really middle it
tossed up on middle and off, presses forward to block
short and wide, the cut seemed to be on but he didn't execute it the way he'd have liked, bounced over his bat
fullish on middle stump, defended into the off side
that's Vettori's third. Nabi goes on the back foot to punch, it bounces more than he expects, and the ball takes his outside edge, well taken by Taylor at slip, that went quickly to him, to his right

and he's gone first ball! Quicker ball from Vettori, and it pins Zazai to the crease, tries to bring his bat down in a hurry to defend it, couldn't bring it down quickly enough. Ball goes with the arm and smacks him on the front pad. I'm not sure that was hitting leg stump, but the umpire thought it was. No reviews left for Afghanistan. Hawkeye says clipping, I'm not convinced.
full, floated across the left-hander, presses forward to defend to - what shall I call him - silly extra cover?
ooh, nearly another. Good short ball, angling into the batsman, and he fends at it uncomfortably and pops it in the air, just over the leaping Williamson at gully
another quick bouncer. Najibullah ducks under it
back of a length, angling away a fair distance outside off stump, left alone
that's full and wide, so full he didn't need to move his feet to flat-bat it through square cover. Lots of bottom hand in that
back of a length outside off, plays away from his body to poke that to backward point
good short ball, angling into the batsman. Did well there, kept his eye on it and swayed away from it
full outside off, and there's that flashing, whippy square drive from Najibullah. Excellent timing again
tossed up outside off, gets a good stride forward to push that to short extra cover
length ball on middle and off, defended into the on side
length ball outside off, blocked to the left of short cover
drifts down leg and Shenwari pounces on it, down on his knee quickly to sweep it firmly to the long leg boundary. Fine leg was in the circle
tossed up on off stump, driven to mid-off
full on off stump, pushed to short cover
wow. That's short from Milne and Najibullah simply leans his weight back and clubs that away over wide mid-on
full on off stump, stayed rooted to the crease and flicked it behind square leg
short, has to fetch that pull from way outside off stump, can't connect
shortish, and that surprises Najibullah with extra bounce. Looks to tuck it away through the leg side, hits him on the chest
in the blockhole outside off, jams down on it to stab it into the off side
full outside off again, poked away to the right of mid-off
floated across towards off stump, defended back towards the bowler
tossed up a bit fuller, tucked carefully into the on side
a little wider outside off, driven to extra cover
down the track now, stays inside the line to hit over extra cover, goes off the outside half of the bat a bit, but he gets more than enough wood on it to smack it away to the boundary
quicker now, on the stumps, defended into the on side
sees him coming down the pitch and looks to slip one down the leg side. Najibullah did well to adjust and squeeze it away to deep square leg
and boom. Najibullah smashes his first ball onto the roof of the stand behind deep midwicket. It was full on off stump, right in his swinging arc after he cleared his front leg

dropped!. Similar line and length, it's the slower ball and he goes for a repeat and doesn't middle it at all. Guptill got under it on the leg side boundary, and I suppose he didn't pick it out of the bright, sunny sky. Didn't judge it, had to reach to his right a little bit, move his hands at the last moment, and it slipped through his grasp
wow. Super shot. That's full outside off and he doesn't really move forward but he leans forward and just shows the full face of the bat to drive it away sweetly though the covers
not quite as full, plays a defensive punch towards squarish cover

full on off stump, poked away towards short midwicket. Thinks about the single, decides against it. Nathan McCullum - I don't know who he's substituting for - throws at the bowler's end, hits the stumps, but Najibullah was safely back in his crease, and they run an overthrow. Went to the third umpire just to be sure.
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
flatter delivery outside off, pushed into the off side
back of a length on off and middle, defended back to the bowler
not quite full enough to drive outside off, faster as well, chops down on it towards cover
down the leg side, swept to short fine leg
length ball on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler, and that's yet another maiden
full-toss on off stump, punched to mid-off, where Milne does the fielding, enabling the TV commentators to tell us that it was he who had gone off the field briefly
bouncer over leg stump. Najibullah leans across, out of the way of it
slower ball on middle stump, goes on the back foot, lets it come on, dabs it softly into the leg side
slower legcutter, shortish, pulled away off the hips towards long leg
back of a length, angling away from off stump, uses the wrists to play that back towards the bowler, who fields it with some nifty use of his feet
full, angling away from off, driven to short cover
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, presses forward to block
goes wider of the crease, bowls it quick and full on off stump. He stays back and defends back to the bowler

goes for the sweep and they've gone up for a caught behind appeal. This was tossed up, and he was through his shot too early, hit his pad, then I think his arm, and popped up into the off side. Ronchi moved quickly and dived to his right to catch it, not given
full on leg stump, clipped into the leg side
a bit of flight outside off, driven firmly to mid-off
full, some width outside off, and he plants his foot forward to drive that with a flourish to the left of cover. Super shot
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, defended to short cover
full outside off again, may have been the slower ball. Too early into the attempted hit over cover, ends up dragging it high over mid-off, stops two-thirds of the way to the boundary
bouncer now. Shenwari gets into a low crouch under it

full and wide again and that is brilliant fielding from Guptill, full-length dive to his left to stop the crisp drive from Shenwari, then comes up quickly with the ball in his right hand to throw at the batsman's end. He had gone out a fair way from his crease, thinking he had beaten the fielder, and would have been out, but he missed and they end up with an overthrow
length ball, angling away from off stump. Goes after it, looking to hit over mid-off, doesn't connect
short and a touch of width, cut away to deep point
back of a length on off stump, punched down the ground to long-on
fullish on leg stump, comes forward to nudge it towards square leg
tossed up on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched away to sweeper cover
loopy outside off, comes forward to dab towards point, and short cover moves quickly to his right to prevent the single
shortish outside off, rides the bounce and steers it to deep point
short outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump, tucked away through forward square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, looks to work it into the on side but Anderson moves quickly to cut it off
bouncer, Shenwari takes his eyes off the ball but ducks low enough to avoid it by a fair margin
full and wide, he has a big swing at it but can't connect. Umpire calls it wide, and it went pretty much right over the tramline
low full-toss outside off, driven hard into the ground, bounces up to Guptill at short cover
full outside off, looks for the pushed single but Guptill is too quick at short cover, moves a couple of steps to his left and puts in a graceful dive
short and wide. Throws his bat at it without moving across, doesn't make contact
back of a length outside off, pushes away from his body and gets a thick edge to third man
length ball on off stump, defended solidly to short extra cover
back of a length outside off, punched firmly but can't get it past Williamson, who dives smartly to his left at backward point to stop it one-handed
yorker on off stump, jams down on it to block towards short cover
back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover
full outside off, a little bit of shape away. Goes for the drive away from his body and gets a thick edge that screams away to the third man boundary
closer to off stump now. Stays in his crease, pokes it away into the covers
yorker outside off, blocked to short cover
length ball outside off, a bit of shape away, left alone
fullish on off stump, clipped away to the left of short midwicket
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball angling away from Najibullah, who plays and misses, poking with an angled bat away from his body
length ball close to off stump, dabbed away to third man with an open face
full outside off, gets on the front foot to push it back to the bowler
length ball, a bit of shape in towards off stump, defended to mid-off
short, a bit of width. Some extra bounce but he rode it well, jumping up to chop it down towards deep point
fullish outside off, and again no footwork from Najibullah. Pokes at it with an angled bat and it slips past his outside edge
full outside off, driven firmly to mid-off
full outside off, checked drive to short cover
length ball outside off, comes forward, plays with an open face, gets a thickish outside edge that rolls to slip

oh man. That's nasty. Bouncer, angled into the batsman, followed him all the way as he ducked and smacked straight on the back of the helmet as he turned his head away from the ball. Gets up and smiles, and all the fielders enquire about his well-being
another bouncer, this time it gets up higher and he ducks safely under it
fullish on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended to short cover
full outside off, and that's a lot of swinging room for Najibullah, who sends it soaring over long-on, into the crowd, where someone makes an unsuccessful attempt at a one-handed catch
full and wide, stands tall and slaps it towards short cover
slower ball, short outside off, pulls, drags it down towards square leg
very full outside off, jabbed back down the ground
length ball outside off, flat-batted towards short cover
slower yorker on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler, and that's the end of Southee's spell
full and wide, goes after it, away from his body, can't connect
back of a length outside off, poked away towards backward point
full outside off, and that is timed very well, just swished his bat into line, but Guptill makes another diving stop at short cover
length ball outside off, clears his front leg, has to reach out a bit to hit over mid-off, doesn't quite middle it, but gets it into the vacant area and it bounces away into the boundary
length ball on middle and off, makes room to poke it away through cover point
slower bouncer, ducks under it, umpire signals wide
gives himself room against the short ball, helps it away towards third man, just wide of Williamson diving to his right from backward point
good length ball on off stump, steps forward and defends
vital, very vital half-century comes up off a poor, short ball that Najibullah cracks through the gap at point. Shouldn't New Zealand be attacking right about now?
good length, with a hint of straightening outside off, and Najibullah is beaten on the push
half-volley outside off and he hammers it through to long-off as the fans roar "Najib, Najib, Najib!"
fuller on middle, Shenwari waits on it and clips it to the right of Baz at midwicket and picks up a neat single

allows the batsman to camp back and cut, the shortish ball does take an outside edge. But it was intentional and thick enough to leap away to the third man boundary. Good job too, because Najibullah slipped while turning for the second

curls a full delivery back in at Shenwari, but he stays so still and nudges the ball into the leg side so late. Good technique. But he is too eager for a single. Lucky that Milne didn't pick the ball up for Shenwari had taken several steps down and was slow to turn
fuller delivery, tucked into the leg side

oh, he's found third man and it's Danny down there! Seemed a good shot, and a good plan. Backs away to get some room to help a short ball up and over. Decent enough contact too, but he is unable to clear the man on the boundary. Simple catch
full and seeking middle stump, Dawlat offers a good view of it as he inches away from the ball. I wouldn't blame him for doing that against a 145kph bowler. Finds an outside edge to third man
good bouncer, skimming over the ear of the ducking batsman and the off stump
fuller delivery on off stump, sliced in front of point for a quick single
starts with a slower ball, that Shenwari picks and slashes over cover. Good work from the New Zealand fielders again, two men chasing after the ball to set up a relay throw
shortish on middle, makes Shenwari leap off his feet and clips behind square leg. Single was there, but doesn't take it
full and outside off, Shenwari attempts a fierce whack down to long-on to bring up the 150
moves around the wicket for a shortish delivery outside off, Dawlat stands rooted to his crease and plonks a horizontal bat out. Beaten
goes a touch more round-arm than usual and seeks the blockhole on middle, Dawlat keeps it out gingerly
fuller delivery outside off, pushed towards point
shortish and going down leg, Shenwari sinks below it and collects the extra
back of a length on off stump at 149 kph, defended
lifts a shortish ball over the head of cover and Shenwari wants a single. He was halfway down, but Dawlat was ball-watching because it was quite close to the leaping fielder. No run taken in the end
stays in line with a back of a length ball and clips to deep square leg. Doesn't want the single this time
stays back to negotiate short of a good length ball on off stump with a straight bat
150kph, shortish and outside off, Shenwari has a poke at it with an open face and is beaten for pace
leaps up off his toes to punch a shortish 140-plus kph delivery outside off into the covers
taken! It was a fuller ball, bowled from around the wicket, and Dawlat went for a bit of a slog. Only manages an outside edge that gives Ronchi a simple take
full delivery on off stump, defended
shortish on off stump, blocked into the covers
fuller delivery on off stump, kept out
seeks the blockhole on off stump, misses it by a couple of inches and Hamid blocks
moves over the wicket for a good length ball on off stump, blocked to finish a wicket maiden
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
this one's angled in towards off stump and Shenwari jumps across to defend
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
length ball outside off, comes forward to push it to point
yorker on middle stump, jams his bat down just in time to squeeze it away into the leg side
Shenwari! That is stunning. Length ball, angling in towards off stump. Clears the front leg and hoicks it away over the straight midwicket boundary. Whack!
length ball, angling away from off stump. Goes for the big heave again, misses

ha! That was angled across again and Shenwari slogged across the line, sliced it high in the air, and McCullum couldn't get to it, running desperately from mid-off. He doesn't look too happy with Anderson, who was closer to the ball but didn't call for the catch
length ball on middle stump, defended to short cover
fullish on off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point
short, angling into the body. Jumps up and steers it away to third man

back of the hand slower ball outside off, flat-batted to the extra-cover boundary, just about beats McCullum, who just doesn't give up, pursues at full tilt and dives full length, pulls it back too, but the momentum causes it to roll back over the rope. Fifty for Shenwari too, super knock
yorker on off stump, jabbed away towards point
another very full ball on off stump, and he opens his bat face to deflect it towards third man
full on middle and leg, clipped down to long-on
full, angling down leg, clips it towards long leg, they don't take the run
slanted across, full, on off stump, swings hard at it, goes to long-on, all along the ground. They don't take the single
shortish, not quite short enough to pull. It's too close to his hip and he ends up spooning a simple catch to Taylor at square leg. Gets a standing ovation from the crowd as he walks off.
back of a length outside off, guided away to third man
short ball outside off, left alone
bouncer, is caught between hooking and leaving, ends up leaving the periscope up, and it goes off the edge, over the keeper, and that's four runs to Hassan
and that's four more, far more convincing. That's a stunning shot, just cleared the front leg and smacked the length ball back over the bowler's head
That's one... length ball angling away, poked away to backward point

and that is that. Well done, Afghanistan. Back of a length on leg stump. Didn't really know what was happening there, took his eyes off the ball and tried to fend at it, ends up hitting his thigh pad and rolling down to fine leg
slower bouncer, Hassan swivels out of the way
shot! That's short outside off and he jumps in the air and carves away the square-cut, places it a long way to the right of third man
slower ball outside off. Hassan looks to pull, swings and misses
length ball outside off, Hassan has a swish and a miss
back of a length outside off, dabs it to backward point, calls Shapoor for a single, sends him back
back of a length outside off, steered away to third man, and Hassan loses his bat while running the single. The two big fast bowlers were both ball-watching, and collided mid-pitch
comes down the track, bowls the slower bouncer outside off, Hassan slogs and misses
shortish outside off, and he makes a bit of room and plays the uppercut to help it away very fine, through the vacant slip region

Adam Milne, whatacatch! Saw him coming down the track and shortened his length, and Hassan miscued his slog, went in the air to the right of long-on and he took it low, diving to his right, and he was holding his right shoulder when he came up after taking the catch. May have hurt it while he rolled over
